sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Reservoir Media's Valuation Upgrade Signals Potential for Future Growth Opportunities
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. has received an improved valuation grade, reflected in key financial metrics such as a P/E ratio of 37 and a low PEG ratio of 0.14, suggesting strong growth potential. The company has consistently demonstrated profitability, with significant net profit and pre-tax profit growth in recent quarters, and healthy long-term net sales growth. This upgrade indicates a promising outlook for future growth opportunities.

feed.title: Responsive Playbooks and the RSVR Inflection
feed.summary: An AI-driven analysis indicates a strong near-term sentiment for Reservoir Media Inc. (NASDAQ: RSVR), potentially influencing neutral mid and long-term outlooks. The analysis identifies an exceptional 30.0:1 risk-reward setup, targeting an 8.1% gain against a 0.3% risk. Three distinct trading strategies are provided: a Position Trading Strategy, a Momentum Breakout Strategy, and a Risk Hedging Strategy, tailored for various risk profiles and holding periods.

feed.title: Reservoir Media (NASDAQ:RSVR) Stock Price Down 2.4% - Time to Sell?
feed.summary: Reservoir Media (NASDAQ:RSVR) experienced a 2.4% drop in its share price to $7.44 on Monday, with trading volume significantly higher than average. The company faces a "Hold" consensus from analysts with an average target price of $11.50, despite a high valuation and a recent EPS miss. Insider selling by Director Adam Rothstein and institutional investor activity, including increased stakes by some funds, are also noted.

feed.title: Reservoir Media Announces Second Quarter Fiscal 2026 Results
feed.summary: Reservoir Media reported strong financial results for the second quarter of fiscal 2026, with significant increases in revenue and net income driven by its Recorded Music and Music Publishing segments. The company made strategic acquisitions, including the Miles Davis catalog, and raised its financial outlook for the full fiscal year. This growth is attributed to disciplined investments and strategic partnerships aimed at long-term value creation.

feed.title: Reservoir Media Releases Investor Presentation on 8-K
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. released an investor presentation on its website, attached to its current report on Form 8-K. The presentation, issued on November 17, 2025, includes forward-looking statements and unaudited financial information. While the company's overall stock score is driven by strong earnings and strategic growth initiatives, the high P/E ratio and negative technical indicators weigh down the score.

feed.title: Reservoir Media, Inc. Releases Investor Presentation
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. has released an investor presentation detailing its strategic initiatives and financial performance. The company, a U.S.-based publicly traded independent music company, reported significant growth in Q2 FY26 with a 12% year-over-year revenue increase and a 10% rise in Adjusted EBITDA. This presentation highlights Reservoir Media's over $1.1 billion investment in music catalog acquisitions and new publishing deals.

feed.title: Reservoir Media Inc reports results for the quarter ended September 30 - Earnings Summary
feed.summary: Reservoir Media Inc (RSVR) reported adjusted earnings of 3 cents per share for the quarter ended September 30, missing the analyst consensus of 4 cents. Despite this, revenue rose 11.7% to $45.44 million, exceeding analyst expectations. Analysts currently rate the shares as a "buy," with a median 12-month price target of $13.25.

feed.title: Reservoir Media (RSVR) Turns Profitable, Challenging Bearish Growth and Valuation Narratives
feed.summary: Reservoir Media (RSVR) recently achieved profitability after years of financial pressure, yet faces challenges with declining earnings and slow revenue growth forecasts. Despite trading below analyst targets and discounted compared to peers, its high P/E ratio indicates investor optimism relies on future asset diversification and margin preservation. Analysts highlight cost pressures and execution risks in new ventures, cautioning investors to consider long-term growth and risks.

feed.title: Reservoir Media, Inc. (NASDAQ:RSVR) Q2 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. reported its Q2 Fiscal 2026 earnings, discussing a 12% top-line growth, with 7% organic revenue increase, and adjusted EBITDA up 10%. Key highlights include the acquisition of Miles Davis's catalog and publishing deal extensions for artists like Nick Drake, alongside an increase in full-year revenue and adjusted EBITDA guidance. The company remains focused on strategic acquisitions, catalog development, and global expansion to drive long-term value.

feed.title: Reservoir Media to Release Second Quarter Fiscal Year 2026 Results on November 4, 2025
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. announced it will release its second fiscal quarter 2026 financial results on November 4, 2025, before market open. The company will host a conference call at 10 a.m. EST on the same day to discuss the results, with a live audio webcast available on its Investor Relations website. Reservoir Media is an independent music company, founded in 2007, with a strong presence in the industry.

feed.title: Reservoir Media, Inc. (RSVR) Q2 Earnings Lag Estimates
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. (RSVR) reported Q2 earnings of $0.03 per share, missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $0.05 per share, though revenues of $45.44 million surpassed expectations. The company's stock has underperformed the S&P 500 year-to-date, and its Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) suggests it will perform in line with the market. Investors are advised to monitor management's commentary and future earnings expectations, as estimate revisions strongly correlate with near-term stock movements.

feed.title: Reservoir Media, Inc. Experiences Revision in Its Stock Evaluation Amid Market Challenges - Markets Mojo
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. has seen a revision in its stock evaluation, with its current price at $7.60 and a -11.53% return over the past year, underperforming the S&P 500. Key financial metrics include a P/E ratio of 37, EV to EBITDA of 13.76, ROCE of 4.79%, and ROE of 3.53%. The article also highlights peer comparisons, showing varied financial health within the industry.

feed.title: Reservoir Media adds Bobby Vinton to its catalog - Traders Union
feed.summary: Reservoir Media has expanded its music catalog by acquiring the works of iconic singer Bobby Vinton. This acquisition includes Vinton's hit song "Mr. Lonely," which has been widely sampled and featured in various media. This move further strengthens Reservoir's presence in the entertainment industry.

feed.title: Miles Davis Publishing Catalog Acquired by Reservoir Media
feed.summary: Reservoir Media has acquired the publishing catalog of legendary jazz musician Miles Davis. The company did not disclose the financial terms but confirmed it is now part of Davis's estate, managed by his children, nephew, and other representatives. Reservoir's founder, Golnar Khosrowshahi, expressed honor at housing such an influential catalog.

feed.title: Jazz Legend Miles Davis' Complete Catalog Acquired by Reservoir Media Ahead of Major 2026 Centennial Celebration
feed.summary: Reservoir Media (NASDAQ: RSVR) has acquired the comprehensive catalog of jazz icon Miles Davis, including publishing, recorded music, and name and likeness rights. This acquisition positions Reservoir to partner with the Miles Davis Estate for a major centennial celebration in 2026, featuring a new feature film, international symphonic shows, and tours. The deal encompasses Davis' extensive body of work, comprising over 60 studio albums and 60 live albums, with collaborations focusing on preserving and promoting his legacy to new audiences.

feed.title: Independent Director Adam Rothstein Sold A Bunch Of Shares In Reservoir Media
feed.summary: Independent Director Adam Rothstein recently sold US$931k worth of Reservoir Media (NASDAQ:RSVR) stock, reducing his holding by 43%. This sale, executed at US$7.57 per share, was the largest by an insider in the last year and occurred below the current share price of US$7.78, which may suggest that insiders deemed a lower price to be fair. Despite this, insiders still own 3.2% of the company, valued at US$16 million, indicating some alignment with shareholders.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Reservoir Media Q4 2025 reveals revenue growth
feed.summary: Reservoir Media (RSVR) reported a Q4 2025 revenue increase of 6% to $41.4 million, beating forecasts, and a full-year revenue of $158.7 million, up 10% year-over-year. Despite exceeding revenue expectations, the company's EPS of $0.04 fell slightly short of the $0.0467 forecast, leading to a 3.33% decline in pre-market trading. The company emphasized strategic acquisitions and international expansion, particularly in emerging markets like India, as key drivers for future growth, while providing a conservative revenue guidance for fiscal year 2026 between $164 million and $169 million.

feed.title: How activist Irenic can amicably build shareholder value at Reservoir Media
feed.summary: Activist investor Irenic Capital Management, holding an 8.14% stake in Reservoir Media (RSVR), is urging the company to undertake a strategic review, including a potential sale, despite its stable financial performance. Irenic, founded by former Elliott Management and Indaba Capital managers, believes that while Reservoir Media has a predictable and growing revenue stream from music royalties, its current public market valuation doesn't reflect its true value, especially since its SPAC IPO. The article suggests a sale to a financial buyer is probable, given the significant ownership by the Khosrowshahi family and Richmond Hill Investments, and the success of similar acquisitions in the industry.

feed.title: Snoop Dogg And Death Row Records Ink Publishing Deal With Reservoir Media
feed.summary: Snoop Dogg and Death Row Records have entered a new publishing agreement with Reservoir Media, covering domestic publishing for Snoop's entire catalog and the Death Row Records catalog. This deal marks a significant moment for Snoop, who reacquired Death Row from MNRK Music Group two years prior, giving him ownership of the label where he began his career. Reservoir Media, founded by Golnar Khosrowshahi, manages over 150,000 copyrights and 36,000 master recordings, and views this partnership as an exciting opportunity to support Snoop's legacy and further the Death Row brand.

feed.title: Reservoir Media faces activist investor call for ‘strategic review to maximize shareholder value’
feed.summary: Activist investor Irenic Capital, owning 8% of Reservoir Media, is demanding a strategic review of the Nasdaq-listed music rights company to maximize shareholder value, threatening to propose its own measures if rejected. Reservoir's board acknowledges shareholder input but indicates a focus on executing its existing strategy. This comes as Reservoir's share price shows strong year-to-date and year-over-year growth, with significant ownership held by Wesbild Inc and Richmond Hill Investments Inc.

feed.title: Jon Decious Signs With Reservoir & One Riot
feed.summary: Jon Decious has signed a joint publishing deal with Reservoir Media, Inc. and One Riot. Based in Nashville, Decious has writing credits on Lainey Wilson’s new album Whirlwind and Miranda Lambert’s forthcoming album Postcards from Texas, and has collaborated with several other notable artists. This deal reflects Decious' rising star in the music industry.

feed.title: Reservoir Announces Publishing Deal With Songwriter-Producer Aaron Zuckerman
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. announced a new publishing deal with Platinum-selling producer and songwriter Aaron Zuckerman. The deal includes Zuckerman's recent co-write "White Claw" by Yung Gravy and Shania Twain, and covers the majority of Yung Gravy's upcoming album and other future projects. This partnership will see Reservoir support Zuckerman in expanding his already diverse and successful body of work across multiple music genres.

feed.title: Arab-Pop Star Nancy Ajram Signs Publishing Deal With Reservoir & PopArabia For ‘Global Opportunities’
feed.summary: Arab-Pop star Nancy Ajram has signed a new publishing deal with Reservoir Media Inc. and its sub-publisher PopArabia, aimed at expanding her global reach. The deal encompasses her entire 25-plus year catalog and future works, solidifying her position as one of the most visible musicians from the MENA region with significant social media influence. This partnership seeks to capitalize on growing international attention on Arabic music and artists, providing Ajram with more global opportunities.

feed.title: If you've been listening to De La Soul lately, you probably have Golnar Khosrowshahi to thank
feed.summary: Golnar Khosrowshahi, CEO of Reservoir Media, successfully acquired and released De La Soul's music catalog to streaming platforms after resolving complex licensing issues. This effort, which took a year and a half, has resulted in 18 million on-demand streams in the first week and created a new model for un­locking music that has been "locked in the vault" due to similar rights issues. It also opened up new licensing opportunities in film, TV, and video games.

feed.title: In a sign of the times, The Spinners sell their catalog of music
feed.summary: Legendary vocal group The Spinners have sold their music catalog and master royalty income to independent music company Reservoir Media, Inc. The deal includes rights for the sole remaining living founding member Henry Fambrough, as well as the late Billie Henderson, Pervis Jackson, and Bobbie Smith. This transaction follows a trend of major music stars selling their catalogs for significant sums.

feed.title: Reservoir Signs Mary Kutter To First Publishing Deal [Exclusive]
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. has signed country singer-songwriter Mary Kutter to her first publishing deal, encompassing her full catalog and future works, including hits like "Wreckage" and "Never Leave." Kutter's songs have garnered over 100 million streams and featured in national ad campaigns and TV series. This deal celebrates her significant achievements and future potential in the country music industry.

feed.title: De La Soul’s Catalog Finally Coming To Streaming In 2023
feed.summary: De La Soul announced that their entire music catalog will finally be available on streaming platforms starting in 2023, following a long-standing legal battle and sample clearance issues. The first six albums will debut on March 3, 2023, with their 1989 hit "The Magic Number" preceding the full release on January 13. This breakthrough comes after Reservoir Media acquired Tommy Boy's discography, resolving contractual disputes that previously prevented their music from being streamed.

feed.title: Egypt’s Mohamed Ramadan to perform at North Coast on August 12
feed.summary: Egyptian superstar Mohamed Ramadan is scheduled to perform at North Coast on August 12. This announcement follows recent deals made by Reservoir Media, Inc. (NASDAQ: RSVR) with PopArabia, including a worldwide publishing deal with Ramadan and the acquisition of Egyptian label 100COPIES, as they expand their presence in the MENA region. Ramadan is a highly popular artist with billions of views on YouTube and a strong global fanbase.

feed.title: Mohamed Ramadan signs deal with new york based Reservoir and Poparabia
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. and PopArabia have announced two new deals, including a worldwide publishing deal with Egyptian rapper and singer Mohamed Ramadan and the acquisition of Egyptian label 100COPIES. These agreements are part of the companies' emerging markets growth strategy in the Middle East and North Africa, aiming to expand their presence and develop local talent. The partnership seeks to solidify Reservoir as an influential player in these markets and promote Eastern talent globally.

feed.title: Reservoir Media moving to new space in Hudson Square — (and other NYC real estate deals)
feed.summary: Reservoir Media Inc. is relocating its operations to a new 12,470 square-foot space at 200 Varick Street in Hudson Square. This move is part of broader New York City real estate news, which also includes SVB Securities expanding its presence on Avenue of the Americas. Other related real estate activities mentioned include CBRE's increased stake in Industrious, a longtime Lower Manhattan jeweler signing a Tribeca lease, and the sale of a popular Harlem restaurant building for $14 million.

feed.title: Reservoir Announces New Deal for the Catalog of Lyricist Larry Kusik
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. announced a new deal for the catalog of the late lyricist Larry Kusik, known for his work on theme songs from films like The Godfather and Romeo and Juliet. The deal includes both publisher's and writer's shares for Kusik's prolific lyrical contributions, which earned industry awards. Reservoir aims to preserve and introduce Kusik's legacy to new audiences.

feed.title: Reservoir Acquires Buddy Cannon’s Producer Catalog
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. has acquired the producer catalog of Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame member Buddy Cannon, including rights to his Kenny Chesney collaborations from 1997 to 2017. The deal encompasses music that has accumulated over three billion streams, 31 million album sales, and 36 million track sales. Cannon expressed that the acquisition felt like the right move, allowing him to turn over his portion of future Kenny Chesney royalties to Reservoir and focus on making new music.

feed.title: Travis Tritt Sells Shares of All Recordings and Songs to Reservoir
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. has acquired major shares of Travis Tritt’s complete catalog, encompassing both master recordings and compositions. Tritt, a Grammy-winning country artist known for hits like "It's a Great Day To Be Alive," joins other country artists in Reservoir's recent acquisitions. The deal includes his latest album, "Set in Stone," and highlights Tritt's continued influence in the country music genre.

feed.title: Reservoir Acquires Travis Tritt Publishing, Recorded Music Catalogs
feed.summary: Reservoir Media, Inc. has acquired the publishing and recorded music catalogs of country music artist Travis Tritt, excluding his most recent album. Tritt is a Grammy winner with significant album sales and numerous No. 1 and Top 10 hits. This acquisition strengthens Reservoir's collection of country catalog classics.
